field.name: homepage_news
field.description: When turned on, your site's most recently published news items will show up on the homepage, immediately following the body text. Congratulations! You now have a Blog.
field.title: Show news on homepage?

field.name: public_contact
field.description: Submissions to the contact-info form will be sent here.
field.title: Public E-Mail Contact

field.name: admin_e_mail_contact
field.description: Contact information, including email, for a person responsible for this site. This information is not part of the site web pages, but will be used by the host administrator if there are questions about the site. Please Note: if this information is missing, or if mail to this address is not answered promptly, your site may be deleted without notice.
field.title: Admin E-Mail Contact

field.name: license
field.description: Choose a Creative Commons license to allow republication of your content. If you don't wish to use a Creative Commons License, you may wish to add a copyright notice to your footer.
field.title: License

field.name: credit_dcn
field.description: Should we show a message at page bottom crediting DCN for site assistance?
field.title: Credit DCN?

field.name: do_list
field.description: Should this site be included in DCN's public listing of sites? (This is set to "no" when a site is first created. Change to "yes" when you're ready to go public.)
field.title: Include in sites listing?

field.name: preferred_url
field.description: If you wish to have your site in the public listing and you are using a domain/host name other than groups.dcn.org, enter your preferred URL here. The URL must be a valid web address, including "http://".
field.title: Preferred web address

field.name: analytics_code
field.description: Add here any code you need inserted at the bottom of the HTML body. Typical use is JavaScript for analytics' tracking.
field.title: Analytics Code

field.name: dbOrgId
field.description: For system manager use only.
field.title: Calendar Database ID

field.name: page_structure
field.description: "Flexible Layout" is more modern and offers good Mobile displays. "Fixed Layout" is more compatible with older sites.
field.title: Page Structure

field.name: page_banner_image
field.description: An optional graphic that will be displayed at the top of each page in place of a text title. Make sure to use a web-standard file format (JPG, JPEG, PNG or GIF) for the image upload.
field.title: Page Banner Image

field.name: page_footer
field.description: This text will display at the bottom of all your pages. Most commonly used for name, address, contact info.
field.title: Page Footer

field.name: page_background_color
field.description: Overall background color for the page. You may specify a CSS color name or hex value.
field.title: Page Background Color

field.name: contrast_background_color
field.description: Background color for boxed elements like column headers.
field.title: Contrast Background Color

field.name: border_color
field.description: Border color for boxed elements like column headers.
field.title: Border Color

field.name: alternate_background_color
field.description: This color will be used as the background color in alternate table rows. A slightly different shade of the Page Background Color is a good choice.
field.title: Alternate Row Shading

field.name: custom_css
field.description: Cascading Style Sheet style-tag definitions. Whatever you specify will override the Simple Sites default style sheet. Please note: you do not need to include the style tags. They are supplied for you.
field.title: Custom CSS

fieldset.name: elements
fieldset.label: Page Elements
fieldset.description: Turn on and off elements of your pages.

field.name: show_search
field.description: When turned on, a site search form will show up in the upper-right corner of every page. If you don't have many pages in your site, this really isn't useful.
field.title: Show site search?

field.name: show_nav
field.description: When turned on, a navigation tabs will be displayed in a horizontal bar in the top-of-page banner. If it isn't helpful, turn it off.
field.title: Show navigation tabs?

field.name: show_breadcrumbs
field.description: When turned on, a "you are here" line will appear under the tab area. This is a navigational device that can help orient users who find themselves deep in a site folder hierarchy. You may wish to turn off breadcrumb display if your site is very shallow (in form, not substance).
field.title: Show breadcrumbs?

field.name: show_login
field.description: When turned on, a "log in" link will appear in the shaded horizontal bar under the banner when the current viewer is not logged in. This is convenient when you're getting started, but may later invite confusion from viewers who may suppose your site has a members-only component. Note that you may always reach a log-in form by just adding "/edit" to the URL of your web site.
field.title: Show log-in link?

field.name: show_lastmod
field.description: When turned on, the date/time the page was last modified will show after the page headline. This will help visitors judge the page's currency.
field.title: Show last modified date?

field.name: facebook_page_id
field.description: Specify a complete Facebook page URL to use Facebook connection features.
field.title: Facebook page address

field.name: enable_fblike
field.description: Do you want to offer a Facebook "Like this page" button on each page?
field.title: Enable "Like this?"

field.name: twitter_id
field.description: Specify a Twitter ID if you wish to offer "follow" links.
field.title: Twitter User ID

field.name: enable_tweet
field.description: Do you want to offer a "Tweet this page" button on each page?
field.title: Enable "Tweet this?"
